original: Broberg, Karl Iwan Sigfrid, konstnär, Göteborg, f. 27/7/87 i Söndrum, Hall. 1. G. 14 m. Anna Andersson, Barn: Gösta f. 14, Rune 22. — Halm- stads tekn. yrkessk. 19-20, Hermods korresp :inst. 20-24, Gbgs musei rit- o. målarsk. 30-33. Studrres. t. Nordamerika 13, Norge o. Danm. 37-39, t. Engl. 47. Målar landskap, stilleben, marin o. gatumoitiv. Delt. o. haft e’gna utstäUn. i Sthlm, Gbg, Hatostad, Varberg, Linköp., Lidköp., Jönköp., Borås o. Luleå. Repr. i Halmstads stads konst-saml., Halmstads rådh., Halmstads lä-rov., Varbergs stadsbibi., Gbgs folk-sk., Borås’ isitads’ konstsaml. samt ett flert. priv. konstsaml. Medl. av Gbgs kon st närs kl., K RO o. Konstnärs för en. Hall an ds ringen.
translated: Broberg, Karl Iwan Sigfrid, artist, Gothenburg, born on July 27, 1887 in Söndrum, Halland. Married once, for 14 years, to Anna Andersson. They had two children: Gösta, born in 1914, and Rune, born in 1922. Broberg attended Halmstad Technical Vocational School from 1919-1920 and Hermods Correspondence Institute from 1920-1924. He also studied at Gothenburg Museum's drawing and painting school from 1930-1933. He traveled to North America in 1913, Norway and Denmark in 1937-1939, and to England in 1947. He paints landscapes, still life, marine, and street scenes, and has participated in and held exhibitions in Stockholm, Gothenburg, Halmstad, Varberg, Linköping, Lidköping, Jönköping, Borås, and Luleå. His art is represented in the collections of Halmstad City Art Collection, Halmstad City Hall, Halmstad High School, Varberg City Library, Gothenburg People's School, Borås City Art Collection, and several private art collections. Broberg is a member of Gothenburg's Art Association, KRO, and the Artists' Association of Halland.

structured.name: Karl Iwan Sigfrid Broberg

education.name: Gothenburg Museum's drawing and painting school

structured.description: Karl Iwan Sigfrid Broberg was a Swedish artist born on July 27, 1887, in Söndrum, Halland. He was married once to Anna Andersson and had two children, Gösta (born in 1914) and Rune (born in 1922). He was a member of several art associations and his artwork is represented in various collections. Broberg painted landscapes, still life, marine, and street scenes, and held exhibitions in several cities. He also pursued technical and correspondence education in Sweden and studied in several countries including North America, Norway, Denmark, and England.
